Announcing a month-long blog series on historic ACLU racial justice cases.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Read the blog now!

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The ACLU has always been guided by a vision: to extend the promise of civil rights and civil liberties to all people. Our centennial year is a moment to reflect on the key civil rights struggles of the past 100 years, including the struggle for racial justice.

To celebrate Black History Month, we're looking back at some of the key court battles that have marked the ACLU's ongoing campaign to pursue racial justice in the United States. This month, we'll be publishing four weekly blogs – each taking a close look at the ACLU's role in monumental cases.

The first blog in the series is available to read now.

The ACLU remains deeply committed to racial justice, and we're thankful for your support in this fight. We hope that you enjoy this blog series, and please feel free to share it with friends and colleagues!

In solidarity,

Rahsaan Hall
Racial Justice Program Director, ACLU of Massachusetts
